infos.value: A blue medicine that has a small crystal inside. The crystal is imbued with healing magic, and the liquid that is released can heal small injuries with ease. As it is easy to acquire, most households have some on hand.

A green medicine that has a large crystal inside. As an improved potion, it can heal even serious injuries. It's easy to use and has become a favorite travel supply of adventurers. It has a unique flavor, so opinions on it vary.

A red medicine that has a star-shaped crystal inside. With one sip, every cell in the body awakens, instantly healing even the gravest of injuries. These potions fetch quite a high price, so they have become a status symbol for the adventurers able to acquire them.

A medicine that restores the TP of the user. The countless golden granules suspended within this liquid sparkle and shine in the light. It is a relatively inexpensive commodity that can be obtained in any town.

A medicine that greatly restores the TP of the user. Due to the faint, mellow glow emitted by the magic crystals contained within, it is not uncommon to see these bottles used ornamentally rather than consumed.

A secret medicine that shines amber, said to have been created by the gods themselves. With just one sip, energy and strength are instantly restored. It is the best restorative medicine, but as no one knows how to reproduce it, only the truly fortunate possess any.

A maroon feather imbued with a scintillating light. A gentle warmth can be felt emanating from it, hinting at the incredible power hidden within. If used on someone who has fainted, it will grant them the energy to fight again.

A transparent, light-blue pill. It is so bitter that even adults recoil at the taste. However, its effectiveness more than makes up for this. It can quickly cure any poison. As it used to be made from snake venom, it pays homage to this history with the snake design on its container.

When used as an optical instillation, it dispels any eye-related maladies caused by monster attacks or magic and restores the user's sight. It contains purified water, and the vial features an ancient eye symbol on the label.

A muddy-brown medicine made from mixing various medicinal herbs. One sniff will alleviate any drowsiness or confusion. The smell is quite strong, however, so most keep it sealed tight when carrying it around.

A pea-green medicine. Originally a concoction of dried herbs, over time it has been refined into liquid medicine. One sip quickly soothes the throat and restores the voice. The name "Echo Herbs" comes from the tale of a voice restored by this medicine that echoed for three days and three nights.

A horn harvested from a unicorn. It glimmers a bluish-white and creates a mystical feeling that causes some to hesitate to use it in spite of themselves. It will alleviate paralysis when used on the afflicted area.

A small bust in the shape of a lovely girl. It was modeled after the story of a maiden who freed a prince from being cursed to live as a frog, and it is prized as a charm to ward off maledictions. It is unknown if there is any truth to this story, but there is no doubting the statue's effectiveness.
Pricking the body with thin needles has long been used for relaxing stiff muscles. That technique is what inspired this gold needle. It can be used to drive away impurities and cure petrification.
These adorable pink pills can cure any and all bodily ailments, but they can only do so if every pill in the bag is taken at once. Users should be careful not to let any get caught in the throat.

A medicine contained within a deep-red bottle. The liquid is the same burning shade of red as the bottle in which it is contained. One sip has the power to instantly restore vitality to even the bedridden.

A torch lit with a wondrous light-purple flame. This flame was purified by a highly virtuous mage, making it inextinguishable. If the flame is held over one cursed by a malicious spirit, it will banish the evil from the body.

A miracle drug beloved by bygone heroes. A mere sip will temporarily grant a stunning boost in strength, energy, insight, and mental capacity. Countless international disputes have broken out over its intense effects. Only one who has bested such conflict could be deserving of this drink, hence its name.

A burgundy liquid in a container made from a monster's horn. When poured over the body, it turns the user belligerent and excitable. Though referred to as a wine, it is in fact much closer to a kind of medicine or holy water. Far from simply being unpalatable, its intense bitterness renders it nearly indigestible.

A drink infused with Shell magic through a special means. One can gain resistance to magical attacks just by drinking it. The first country in recorded history to supply this drink to their soldiers won great military victories.

A drink infused with Protect magic through a special means. It is an extraordinary product that makes the body tough just by drinking it. For this reason, it is used not only in battle, but also in hunting, construction, and other dangerous professions to prevent injuries. There are many stories of people carelessly forgetting to drink it before doing dangerous work and getting seriously injured.

Water drawn from a spring that is said to have healing abilities. Drinking this water gradually heals all injuries from the inside out. Curiously, even if the container is turned upside down, the spring water will not pour out.

A thick orange medicine. When ingested, the entire body gradually becomes warm before experiencing a surge of vitality. It has a honey-like sweetness that makes it easy to drink, so it is prized as a tonic for illnesses as well.

An improved version of a secret medicine that only stalwarts from a certain area are permitted to drink. The moment it touches the tongue, pain rushes through the drinker's entire body. However, if the pain is overcome, the drinker can gain power beyond normal limits. As it takes a large toll on the body, it should not be taken excessively.

A deeply purple, ridiculously sweet medicine. It has no magical power of its own, but it activates the organs within one's body and temporarily raises one's magical capabilities. It is reported to improve the effectiveness of studying for novice mages during training.

A medicine with a refreshing taste. Though its effects are temporary, this potion bestows the drinker with the kind of agility that would put a thief to shame. Drinking too much will cause the body to become faster than the mind can handle, leading to unintended missteps.

An extraordinary medicine characterized by its unique stickiness and pungent odor. Drinking it will raise one's concentration, sharpening awareness down to the very fingertips. Even the smallest of openings can be sighted, enabling the drinker to deal lethal blows to enemies.

A medicine made from plants that grow freely throughout all regions of Ardra. This strangely shaped root has medicinal properties that, when consumed in a concentrated dose, recover one's energy. Though the reason for its efficacy remains unclear, it has long been used without side effects. It is rather bitter, but at least it is cheap and widely available.

A restorative medicine made from a concentration of curiously shaped plant roots, concentrated further to boost its medicinal effects. It recovers a greater amount of energy, though it is now even more bitter. Complaints about the taste generally come from first-time users, since those accustomed to it know that the taste is proportional to its healing properties.

A concentrated restorative extract made from boiling down plant roots. Few doubt its healing properties, but many consider its blackish-blue appearance less than appetizing. Just a drop will cause one's sense of taste to dull for minutes on end. Adventurers drink it out of necessity, not because they want to.

Only the finest roots were used in the creation of this high-grade healing medication. Although supremely effective, it is less bitter than typical medications, perhaps due to the quality of the roots used. These appealing aspects make adventurers practically drool at the sight of it, though it is seldom found on the market.

This concoction fully restores the mind and body to the same state as having entered the ring for the first time, allowing the drinker to compete in the maximum number of matches allowed by the arena. It appears to be a blend of numerous restorative medicines and other ingredients that give the face a healthy glow.

A medicine that fully recovers the power of will necessary to challenge raid bosses. Attacking raid bosses requires immense will and mental fortitude; using this medicine bestows the same effects as having taken ample rest since last squaring up against a raid boss.

A medication that fully restores the mind and body, allowing one to fight in the maximum allowed number of strictly regulated class matches. It is said to heal any and all aches and ailments, even loosening up stiff shoulders. Children and non-contestants are generally prohibited from drinking this strong medicine.

A tiny bronze statue closely resembling a turtle-shaped monster. Some claim that these statues were either formed naturally or crafted in a distant age, but the truth is that most were made quite recently. They are not valued for their antiquity but rather for their metal. They are often bought only to be repurposed into other items.

A silver turtle statue small enough to fit in the palm of one's hand. Some still exist that were made in ancient times, but their antiquity does not add to their value. Newer reproductions are quite common, and most are used as crafting materials after being purchased. Their selling price is generally determined by their size.

Sizes vary to some extent, but it would generally be too difficult to carry this statue without both hands. They are often bought and sold at prices far higher than their size would suggest, the reason being that they're a favored ornament of the elite to display both status and wealth.

Gil snapper statues come in all shapes and sizes, but those of superb craftsmanship dating back to ancient times are in another class altogether. The most ancient of these statues can be found among ruins, with new discoveries being made to this day. Many attest that even more expensive statues are still yet to be found.

An item left behind by a former adventurer to pass on their experiences to others. The creator drew out their memories of battle and sealed them in the form of a small cube. Holding it in prayer will cause its energy to encircle the user, upon which the memories will flow as if absorbed into the user's body.

A small cube containing the memories of battle left behind by a former adventurer. Using this cube allows one to feel the adventurer's memories as their own. When crafted, the amount of memories within the cube can be determined by its color and quality. This silver cube contains a mid-level amount of memories.

A cube that contains the essence of an adventurer's memories, sealed away in the form of energy. Opening the cube allows one to absorb this energy and use the experiences as their own. As the memories themselves are not actually stored within the cube, the recollections of this former adventurer remain unknown.

A rainbow-colored cube filled with countless memories of battle. The memories themselves are diverse and contain subtle details such as defensive body postures and mental strategies to employ mid-fight. However, such fine details are said to be lost on those who do not already have some level of experience on the battlefield.

There are some monsters that wield powerful special abilities. Using these monsters as ingredients will yield a liquid medicine that slightly enhances one's special moves. The pot's design features an imaginary monster, depicted in the act of unleashing a sinister ball of energy.

There are some monsters that wield powerful special abilities. Using these monsters as ingredients will yield a liquid medicine that moderately enhances one's special moves. A variety of these pots exist—their color and shape differing with each effect. Collecting all of them might provide a sense of achievement.

There are some monsters that wield powerful special abilities. Using these monsters as ingredients will yield a liquid medicine that greatly enhances one's special moves. The monster depicted on this pot is wearing a crown, hinting at the medicine's royally impressive effects. Still, drinking this bittersweet concoction is no easy task.

A small green stone with a faintly flickering light in its center. The lights dwelling within these stones are said to be human memories. Collecting several of them can increase one's battle experience and improve job training.

A small blue stone with a faintly flickering light in its center. The lights dwelling within these stones are said to be human memories. Collecting several of them can increase one's battle experience and improve job training.

A small purple stone with a faintly flickering light in its center. The lights dwelling within these stones are said to be human memories. Collecting several of them can increase one's battle experience and improve job training.

A small yellow stone with a faintly flickering light in its center. The lights dwelling within these stones are said to be human memories. Collecting several of them can increase one's battle experience and improve job training.

A small red stone with a faintly flickering light in its center. The lights dwelling within these stones are said to be human memories. Collecting several of them can increase one's battle experience and improve job training.

A green ore that was worshipped as a holy stone long ago. These stones retain the memories of training techniques amassed by their former owners, and this particular stone contains memories of sword techniques. How these stones retain memories is unclear, but it is thought that they share some similarity with crystals.

People have long believed this deep-blue ore to contain some mysterious power. It exhibits the same memory retention properties found in jadeite, and this particular stone contains memories of sword techniques. The memories will vanish upon use, though the stone will likely absorb new memories with the passage of time.

A purple ore that has fascinated people for generations. It exhibits the same memory retention properties found in jadeite, and this particular stone contains memories of sword techniques. There are a number of stones that house human memories, and all of them can be found in nature.

A yellow ore that, when processed, reflects light with a brilliant golden glow. It exhibits the same memory retention properties found in jadeite, and this particular stone contains memories of sword techniques. These stones that house human memories were discovered while investigating the nature of crystals.

A red ore that changes hue depending on where the light hits it. It exhibits the same memory retention properties found in jadeite, and this particular stone contains memories of sword techniques. The memories will vanish upon use, though it is thought that the stone will absorb new memories with the passage of time.

A precious stone imbued with the memories of a nameless hero of exceptional talent who accomplished extraordinary deeds. It is said to contain memories of all job classes and that—depending on its color—training with it will grant one the various memories stored within.

Despite its mostly spherical shape, this green stone occurs in nature and is not man-made. Training with it will allow one to obtain memories based on the color of the stone.

Fragments of thought can be used to awaken and enhance visions, and many of those fragments belong to a certain element such as fire or water. Rarely, some fragments are found that can be used regardless of elemental affiliation. This fragment can amplify the memories of any vision, and as such it is said to be quite extraordinary.

A special crystal that emits a faint, fiery red glow. Bathing an esper blessed with the protection of fire in this light will awaken its dormant powers. The strength awakened by this light changes depending on the size of the crystal and the intensity of its glow, but the power contained within has remained a mystery.

A special crystal that emits a fiery red glow. Exposing an esper blessed with the protection of fire to this light will cause its powers to grow. When given to an esper, there will be a momentary flash of light before it shatters. The crystal's form will no longer be visible to the eye, having burst into tiny pieces as fine as sand.

A special crystal that emits a bright, fiery red glow. Exposing an esper blessed with the protection of fire to this light will cause its powers to grow. When magicite grows beyond a certain size, small crystalline pillars begin to form on it. The more pillars there are, the greater the effect on the esper's growth.

A special crystal that emits a powerful, fiery red glow. Exposing an esper blessed with the protection of fire to this light will cause its powers to grow. It takes hundreds upon thousands of years for crystals to reach such a large size. It is said that these large crystals can only be found in uncharted locations and in places inhabited by powerful monsters.

An item that allows one to reexperience the rigors of a battle already fought through image training. The same items and rewards received from the actual battle will be obtained after use.

An item that allows the user to reexperience the rigors of battles fought in faraway lands. No actual battle takes place; rather, the user experiences a concentrated burst of image training. The same items and rewards received from the actual battle will be obtained after use.

Adamantite is a metal said to be even harder than diamond. It can increase the capabilities of equipment when used as a refining material. Adamantite exists in differing degrees of hardness; the harder the adamantite, the greater the skill required to handle it.

A type of metal known for being extremely hard. While weapons and armor are generally made from iron, forging with the addition of adamantite will further increase the capabilities of the finished product. Though it was mined from a relatively shallow layer of the earth, this type of adamantite is nonetheless quite solid.

A type of metal known for being extremely hard. It is found deep underground and will vastly improve the quality of any equipment it tempers. Generally, this is considered the highest quality of adamantite that can be obtained by human mining efforts.

A type of metal known for being extremely hard. It is found within the deepest layer of strata, and any arms tempered with it will be improved to near perfection, but this precious metal can only be found in protrusions of the earth that result from earthquakes. It is coveted by even the world's most renowned blacksmiths.

The quality of equipment depends greatly on the talent of the smith who forged it. Books that hold the secrets of these artisans abound, yet many have been magicked so as to be unreadable more than once—a trick to prevent those secrets from spreading. This tome contains methods for refining swords.

A stone with imagery of a human face on its surface. This one's face appears sad. The stone itself does not have the capacity to feel.

Murky since the time of its collection, it appears that some unknown ingredients have been dissolved within this liquid. These ingredients could have an effect when used to craft.

Sap that has seeped to the surface of a tree and hardened. As the color and composition of the sap differs depending on the type of tree, so does the effect it produces when it's used for crafting.

Sap that has seeped to the surface of a tree and hardened. Some type of insect can be seen encased within. As the color and composition of the sap differs depending on the type of tree, so does the effect it produces when it's used for crafting.

Sap that has seeped to the surface of a tree and hardened. It is quite rare for sap to be this red in color. As the color and composition of the sap differs depending on the type of tree, so does the effect it produces when it's used for crafting.

Sap that has seeped to the surface of a sacred tree and hardened. Unlike other types of sap, this one is often found in the shape of a crystal. As the color and composition of the sap differs depending on the type of tree, so does the effect it produces when it's used for crafting.
Sand gathered from a location long thought to be flowing with mystical energy. The sand's color and coarseness differs depending on the location.

A wad of an ogre's hair. Each strand is thicker and stiffer than that of a human's. Since ogres live in unsanitary environments, careless handling when crafting may result in contact with the bodily fluids and microbes adhered to their hair, causing inflammation of the skin. Handle with caution.

The ashes often left after battling a bomb. Though it is easily collectible and thus has little monetary value, it is an excellent crafting ingredient that can grant unique transformations to other materials.

Though the malboro is a fearsome monster, its newly sprouted tentacles are thin and too weak to coil around objects. Some collectors prune the tentacles for use in crafting, but caution must be taken with the thicker ones—even when severed, they are capable of strangling the holder.

Wolf-type monsters have fangs, but they fall out and regrow at a quick pace in order to maintain sharpness. In addition to being crafted into equipment, these fangs can be processed into various accessories as well, so it is not uncommon to see people gathering them in forests.

Part of the beak of a zuu, a large avian monster. Not only are the beaks large, but they are so hard that some zuus even use them for pecking attacks, making crafting with them difficult. However, they can be broken down into a usable powder if roasted over an open flame for several hours.

The structure of a skeleton-type monster is preserved by magical forces and will crumble upon defeat in battle. The remaining bone chips can be used for crafting either as is or after being ground up into a powder.

The ahriman is a classic devil-type monster that features a spherical body with wings, bird-like feet, one eerie eye, and a gaping mouth. Though seemingly emotionless, in extremely rare cases it may shed tears of pity for its enemy mid-battle. These tears are highly valued as crafting materials.

A metal ore often used as a material for weapons and armor. When refined, it takes on a dazzling silver hue. Tougher than actual silver, lightweight, and easy to process, it is certainly an ideal metal for creating equipment. It is used not only for crafting but also for high-class furnishings and artworks.

A recipe that describes how to combine materials in order to craft a Longsword. If one possesses the correct type and quantity of materials, it is possible to craft the item simply by following the recipe. This method is practiced all over the world as it does not require the expertise or skill of a blacksmith.

Some equipment can be used in a special way. This medicine will slightly draw out the potential of such equipment. The monster depicted on the pot appears to be holding something, although exactly what that is has remained entirely indecipherable.

Some equipment can be used in a special way. This medicine will moderately draw out the potential of such equipment. At a cursory glance, this pot's design seems identical to a mini armor pot, but in fact the monster depicted appears to have grown somewhat.

Some equipment can be used in a special way. This medicine will greatly draw out the potential of such equipment. The monster depicted on this pot is wearing a crown, hinting at the medicine's royally impressive effects. These effects will gradually weaken after opening, so the medicine should be consumed in short order.

A small hammer used by a highly skilled dwarven blacksmith when adjusting equipment to better suit its owner. This hammer allows one to reset the enhancements on a piece of equipment while keeping its special abilities intact. Be careful, as any materials that were used on the equipment will not be restored.

Chocobos receive training while in the stables to discourage them from running faster than their riders can handle. This ticket makes the chocobo forget that training, enabling it to run around at top speed. The chocobo's favorite food is printed on both sides of the ticket.

A ticket that amplifies a chocobo's latent potential, allowing it to dash forth at speeds far greater than normal. Issued by the chocobo trainers' guild, this ticket has a portrait of a female chocobo drawn on the back and the chocobo's favorite food drawn on the front.

An expedition ticket with a greatly increased effect. It is said that a chocobo given this ticket will instantly enter a state of having explored for several hours, looking as though it suddenly skidded to a halt mid-run. The back of the ticket has a chocobo eater drawn on it, bestowing the chocobo with fight-or-flight levels of speed.

Good food is indispensable when training at the barracks. This candy's high sugar content stimulates the nervous system for a short while. Memories from the day's training become all the more vivid, and the body is more easily able to remember those sensations.

Good food is indispensable when training at the barracks. The preservation of jerky allows it to be carried anywhere at any time, and as such it sees extensive use as provisions for soldiers. It stimulates muscle tissue, allowing experience gained from fighting to more easily take root.

Good food is indispensable when training at the barracks. This chocobo confection is a steamed treat packed with sweet jam that has the image of a chocobo grilled onto the top. Its sugar content is higher than that of candy, leading to longer-lasting stimulation of the nervous system.

Good food is indispensable when training at the barracks. Both capturing and cooking the massive avian known as the zuu is extremely difficult for human hands to manage. Once its size is accounted for, however, it can be cooked just like any other fowl. Cutting the wings down to size is a classic preparation for this meat.

Good food is indispensable when training at the barracks. This soup is prepared by making a paste out of the edible portion of the typically flame-engulfed body of a bomb. Small bomb fragments are then added to the paste before it is heated. This smooth soup has a peculiar texture and seems to crackle on the tongue.

Good food is indispensable when training at the barracks. The behemoth is a fearsome-looking creature, but the exquisite tenderness of its meat means that it can be made into steak of the highest quality. Due to its extreme nourishing effects and low fat content, some people's diets consist of nothing but this meat.

An amulet that raises the level of a guild statue's blessing. It was made to imitate a snake, which—through the repeated shedding of its skin—is considered to be a symbol of birth and longevity in Ardra. Those who seek the power of the serpent often wear these amulets or use them as decorations.

An item that bestows the blessing of increased HP when offered up to the serpent statue. This fist-sized amulet was made to resemble the head of a serpent, and it was crafted with the greatest attention to detail. The amulet's blessing may in fact be directly related to its high craftsmanship; some believe that its effects increase as the creator pours more of their soul into their work.
